title: Hotdog-Sandwich Taxonomy Resolution Framework

prerequisites: Secure buy-in from key stakeholder groups
steps.outcome: Create an authoritative body to develop a comprehensive taxonomic standard
risks: Difficulty achieving consensus among diverse stakeholders
Potential for political interference or lobbying

prerequisites: Commission gathers input from structural, cultural, and practical experts
steps.outcome: A classification framework that balances structural, cultural, and functional criteria
risks: Potential for continued debate over edge cases and ambiguous items

prerequisites: Commission defines clear decision-making processes and appeals procedures
steps.outcome: Provide legitimate channels for stakeholders to resolve classification disagreements
risks: Resistance to ceding authority to a centralized decision-making body
Potential for politicization of the dispute resolution process

steps.action: Launch Public Education and Engagement Campaign
prerequisites: Commission develops accessible explanations of the taxonomic framework
Secure media partnerships to widely disseminate information
steps.outcome: Increase public understanding and acceptance of the classification standards
risks: Difficulty overcoming deep-seated personal beliefs and cultural attachments
Potential for continued public debate and 'food classification wars'

steps.action: Integrate Taxonomy into Regulations and Industry Standards
prerequisites: Obtain buy-in from relevant government agencies and industry associations
steps.outcome: Ensure consistent application of the classification framework across sectors
risks: Resistance from entrenched industry practices and regulatory inertia
Potential for unintended consequences or loopholes in implementation

resource_requirements: Funding for commission operations and public engagement
